supporting_spans: under cover of the night. But since Glenarvan's conversation with the chief, it seemed wise to abandon this design.
Kai-Koumou, who had hitherto controlled himself, trembled with rage, and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence directly contradicts the claim by showing that Glenarvan was rescued by Wallace and not by a bird-of-paradise picture book.

analysis.claim_text: As a boy he was rescued by British biologist Wallace, who left behind a bird-of-paradise picture book that, twenty years later, convinced him Glenarvan was linked to the naturalist.

sub_claims.text: As a boy he was rescued by British biologist Wallace.
Twenty years later, he found the bird-of-paradise picture book.
The book convinced him Glenarvan was linked to the naturalist.
